channel.title: DoS Tool
channel.description: Am I allowed to post a DoS Tool, not a DDoS tool.

item.title: DoS Tool
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Not allowed here…

And it seems someone already beat me to banning #haste. There is no reason to own a botnet other then for malicious purposes.

Read full topic

item.title: DoS Tool
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:32, topic:394605”][quote author=m.dog311 link=topic=491791.msg3601146#msg3601146 date=1305581934]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=491791.msg3601135#msg3601135 date=1305581300]

brb checking if murdering a member of the forum is against the rules

It’s not.
[/quote]Great, so I can’t get banned for it!?

EDIT - Sigh… I’ll just come straight rather than get sarcastic.

[quote]Rule 1:
Moderators lock topics/remove posts and topics/hand infractions to users at their own discretion as required to foster a positive community. Any disagreement with a staff member’s decision is to be resolved through the use of the PM system. Any public disputes are unacceptable and punishable.[/quote]

I think that about clears that up? They obviously can, and will ban people if they need to, in order to foster a positive community.

Yet your bans have always been reversed…
[/quote]What bans?[/quote]
I banned you once didn’t I? And then newty reversed it iirc.

Read full topic

item.title: DoS Tool
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I think if there was proof you were a bully, there is a chance you could get infracted. It all depends on what the mods interpret to be a force against a positive community. Maybe they don’t care about bullies, but they do care about murderers and scammers.

Read full topic

brb checking if murdering a member of the forum is against the rules

It’s not.
[/quote]Great, so I can’t get banned for it!?

EDIT - Sigh… I’ll just come straight rather than get sarcastic.

[quote]Rule 1:
Moderators lock topics/remove posts and topics/hand infractions to users at their own discretion as required to foster a positive community. Any disagreement with a staff member’s decision is to be resolved through the use of the PM system. Any public disputes are unacceptable and punishable.[/quote]

I think that about clears that up? They obviously can, and will ban people if they need to, in order to foster a positive community.[/quote]

So if I bullied someone from MSCP at my school, I could get infracted?

[/quote]
It’s not.[/quote]Great, so I can’t get banned for it!?

EDIT - Sigh… I’ll just come straight rather than get sarcastic.

Rule 1: [b]Moderators[/b] lock topics/remove posts and topics/[b]hand infractions to users at their own discretion as required to foster a positive community[/b]. Any disagreement with a staff member's decision is to be resolved through the use of the PM system. Any public disputes are unacceptable and punishable.

I think that about clears that up? They obviously can, and will ban people if they need to, in order to foster a positive community.
